tool.name: applyChloro

param.name: working_folder
param.displayname: Input: Folder Location of Dark Targets GDBs
param.dialogReference: This parameter points to the folder containing all the yearly GDBs that have been previously created with the "1_Condition Yearly Dark Targets Data" script tool. This folder should normally be named "Products" and contains the yearly GDBs (named "2010.gdb", "2011.gdb", etc.)

tool.summary:
This script applies the attribute values of near-surface concentration of chlorophyll_a, measured in mg/m-3, to each dark target polygon in the yearly GDBs.

The "1a_Download Chlorophyll_a Values" script must be run beforehand in order for the chlorophyll_a data to be available for value extraction.

Two new fields are created for each feature class: "chlor_a" and "chlor_a_5x5". For "chlor_a", the raster value is extracted at the centroid of each dark target. For "chlor_a_5x5", the mean of the surrounding neighborhood (of 5 by 5 pixels) is calculated before extracting the value at the centroid of each dark target. If the extracted value is null, maybe due to no MODIS acquisition in the area on that particular day or cloud cover obscuring observation, a value of "-9999" is applied to the field.

If the "chlor_a" field already exists in the feature class, the script does not recalculate the values and skips ahead to the next feature class.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This script applies the attribute values of near-surface concentration of chlorophyll_a, measured in mg/m-3, to each dark target polygon in the yearly GDBs.

The "1a_Download Chlorophyll_a Values" script must be run beforehand in order for the chlorophyll_a data to be available for value extraction.

Two new fields are created for each feature class: "chlor_a" and "chlor_a_5x5". For "chlor_a", the raster value is extracted at the centroid of each dark target. For "chlor_a_5x5", the mean of the surrounding neighborhood (of 5 by 5 pixels) is calculated before extracting the value at the centroid of each dark target. If the extracted value is null, maybe due to no MODIS acquisition in the area on that particular day or cloud cover obscuring observation, a value of "-9999" is applied to the field.

If the "chlor_a" field already exists in the feature class, the script does not recalculate the values and skips ahead to the next feature class.
